greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle T(n,k) read by rows: row n contains the first n Lucas numbers A000204.
comment: Reading rows from the right to the left yields A104764.

Sequence B is called a reluctant sequence of sequence A, if B is triangle array read by rows: row number k coincides with first k elements of the sequence A. Sequence A104765 is the reluctant sequence of A000204. - _Boris Putievskiy_, Dec 14 2012
link: G. C. Greubel, Table of n, a(n) for the first 50 rows, flattened
Boris Putievskiy, Transformations Integer Sequences And Pairing Functions arXiv:1212.2732 [math.CO]
formula: a(n) = A000204(m), where m = n-t(t+1)/2, t = floor((-1+sqrt(8*n-7))/2). - _Boris Putievskiy_, Dec 14 2012
example: First few rows of the triangle are:
mathematica: Table[LucasL[k], {n, 1, 10}, {k, 1, n}] // Flatten (* _G. C. Greubel_, Dec 21 2017 *)
program: (PARI) for(n=1,10, for(k=1,n, print1(fibonacci(k+1) + fibonacci(k-1), ", "))) \\ _G. C. Greubel_, Dec 21 2017
results.author: _Gary W. Adamson_, Mar 24 2005
ext: Edited and extended by _R. J. Mathar_, Jul 23 2008
